DataElement.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome Unclassifiable Disease or Disorder Subgroup Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of myelodysplastic syndrome, unclassifiable disease or disorder subgroup type.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome Unclassifiable Disease or Disorder
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subtype of myelodysplastic syndrome which initially lacks findings appropriate for classification into any other myelodysplastic category.  There are no specific morphologic findings.  The diagnosis can be made in the following instances: 1. in cases of refractory cytopenia with unilineage dysplasia or refractory cytopenia with multilineage dysplasia but with 1% blasts in the peripheral blood; 2: in cases of myelodysplastic syndrome with unilineage dysplasia which are associated with pancytopenia; 3: in cases with persistent cytopenia (s) with 1% or fewer blasts in the blood and fewer than 5% in the bone marrow, unequivocal dysplasia in less than 10% of the cells in one or more myeloid lineages, and cytogenetic abnormalities considered as presumptive evidence of myelodysplastic syndrome. (WHO, 2008)_Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

(WHO, 2008)

Property.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

PermissibleValues.value: MDS-U based on defining cytogenetic abnormality
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, Based on Defining Cytogenetic Abnormality

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, Based on Defining Cytogenetic Abnormality
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Myelodysplastic syndrome, unclassifiable characterized by persistent cytopenia (s) with 1 percent or fewer blasts in the blood and fewer than 5% in the bone marrow, unequivocal dysplasia in less than 10 percent of the cells in one or more myeloid lineages, and cytogenetic abnormalities considered as presumptive evidence of myelodysplastic syndrome.

Concepts.longName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, with Defining Cytogenetic Abnormality
Concepts.definition: Myelodysplastic syndrome, unclassifiable characterized by persistent cytopenia (s) with 1 percent or fewer blasts in the blood and fewer than 5% in the bone marrow, unequivocal dysplasia in less than 10 percent of the cells in one or more myeloid lineages, and cytogenetic abnormalities considered as presumptive evidence of myelodysplastic syndrome.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, With 1 Percent Blasts

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, With 1 Percent Blasts
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Myelodysplastic syndrome, unclassifiable characterized by refractory cytopenia with unilineage dysplasia or refractory cytopenia with multilineage dysplasia but with 1 percent blasts in the peripheral blood.

Concepts.longName: Myelodysplastic Syndrome, Unclassifiable, with 1 Percent Blasts
Concepts.definition: Myelodysplastic syndrome, unclassifiable characterized by refractory cytopenia with unilineage dysplasia or refractory cytopenia with multilineage dysplasia but with 1 percent blasts in the peripheral blood.
